assigner 0.5.5

hack to switch function for parallel computation based on OS

Source: R/mclapply_win.R
assigner_parallel.Rd

parallel::mclapply doesn't work on Windows, because forking is not supported. This function defines a socket version of mclapply for windows computer An implementation that switch automatically the parallel process when detecting the os. The code below was inspired from parallel mclapply, Nathan VanHoudnos and Eric Archer.

mclapply_win(X, FUN, ..., mc.preschedule = TRUE, mc.set.seed = TRUE,
  mc.silent = FALSE, mc.cores = NULL, mc.cleanup = TRUE,
  mc.allow.recursive = TRUE)

.assigner_parallel(X, FUN, ..., mc.style = "ETA", mc.substyle = NA,
  mc.cores = getOption("mc.cores", 2L),
  ignore.interactive = getOption("ignore.interactive", F),
  mc.preschedule = TRUE, mc.set.seed = TRUE, mc.cleanup = TRUE,
  mc.allow.recursive = TRUE)

.assigner_parallel_mc(X, FUN, ..., mc.preschedule = TRUE,
  mc.set.seed = TRUE, mc.silent = FALSE,
  mc.cores = getOption("mc.cores", 2L), mc.cleanup = TRUE,
  mc.allow.recursive = TRUE, affinity.list = NULL)

Value

For mclapply, a list of the same length as X and named by X.

For mclapply, a list of the same length as X and named by X.
